name: La Posada del Fin del Mundo

reviews.text: We recently spent 4 nights at La Posada and found it quite comfortable. The place is loaded with personality, and we enjoyed talking to many of the other guests. We liked the location with a convenient walk to restaurants and downtown area. Some newer properties are available, but the disadvantage is having to drive or take a shuttle into town. Staff is great as noted so well in other reviews. We would stay again on another trip!
reviews.title: Personality

reviews.text: The Posada del Fin Del Mundo is a very comfortable place that has a fine breakfast...a rarity in Argentina. The rooms are nice and the hotel is located near the main strip of Ushuaia. A really good value Marcelo and Ana are extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the area. I had a really nice stay here for 4 nights and recommend it to anyone coming to Ushuaia!!!
reviews.title: Friendly and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in Posada del Fin del Mundo the maid opened the door. She didnt speak any English and we didnt speak any Spanish. But after awhile we understand eachother well. We got room three: a nice room with a garden.
reviews.title: Nice B&B in Ushuaia
Perfect
reviews.text: The bed of the room was too small for two persons, this could have been a bit bigger. We didn't slept very well. Bathroom is normal and clean. You get a separate key to use the guest entrance of the B&B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The posada is a 5 minutes walk from the city center, so you're close to the restaurants, supermarket and shops. Go to NP tierra del Fuego, the surrounding will take your breath away.
reviews.title: very overpriced, needs a make-over bad, but excellent service & breakfast though

reviews.text: Well, in fact, La Posada is a beautiful, rustic inn in a quiet neighorhood up the hill from the tourist hubbub. It is perfect for independent travelers and is not very expensive for Ushuaia if you are looking for comfort. It's a relatively easy 10 minute walk up the hill from Av. San Martin, the main street with most of the shops and restaurants. I had asked for a room with a shared bathroom, but was upgraded to a fully private room on my arrival. Mine had a queen and single bed in it. Overkill for a solo traveler, but I am not complaining. I loved my room. It was spacious and felt like a real bedroom. The wood paneling and exposed beams were really charming and fit the style of the place. The bed and pillows were perfect for me and I appreciated having a nice side-chair for sitting and reading or watching TV. In the shower, the hot water was plentiful. The rest of the posada was so homey and was attractively furnished and decorated, like a country lodge. From the top floor, which has the common rooms for eating, sitting, and meeting the other guests, you have wonderful views and can see the mountains (not easy to miss) and the a bit of the Beagle Channel. Breakfast was good, with eggs to order. Travelers should be aware that this is an inn, so there is no elevator. Also, consider bringing slippers, especially if it is winter, because the bedroom floors are uncovered tile. I never saw the cat, but the dog was a typically friendly and delightful chocolate lab. Thanks to Ana for making such a warm , peaceful, and aesthetically appealing envrionment and thanks to her and to Marcelo for taking such good care of me and helping with my tourism and other needs.
reviews.title: What can I say? It felt like staying in a beautiful, rustic home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is worth traveling to the ends of the Earth to stay at. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The ambiance and food was wonderful. We are so greatful that it was recommended to us and we went. We caught a couple great sunrises from the deck off the livingroom. A great way to start your day.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked everything about this place. The building itself, the common rooms, the friendly host and owner, the breakfast and the dog and cat in the living room with a large window looking down on Ushuaia and the Beagel Channel. Yes this place is not the most modern, but who wants to swap this with character and cosyness. We travelled 3 weeks through Argentina and stayed at various places, but this place for me makes the top cut. I´ve had my best breakfasts right here.
reviews.title: A charming place with character and warmth

reviews.text: You are always made to feel a special guest at the Posada. If you are after a generic hotel experience then this is not the place for you. The Posada is quirky and quiet, with amazing views of Ushuaia, helpful and friendly staff, and one of the best breakfasts in Argentina.
reviews.title: No better Place to Stay in Ushuaia

reviews.text: At the Posada you are made to feel welcome.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Argentina - felt like home!!

reviews.text: We stayed at La Posada del Fin del Mundo in Ushuaia for two days and one night after spending a couple of days in El Calafate. Overall the experience at La Posada was "okay" but there were a couple of things that I want to point out. The common areas a very inviting and have a beautiful view of Beagle Channel. The service is wonderful and Marcelo was extremely helpful in booking two amazing excursions for us. What I was not satisfied with was the condition of the bedrooms and bathrooms. I am not sure if we stayed in rooms that have yet to be remodeled, but we just felt like they could have been a lot nicer with some simple changes. The shower was not clean and had hair on the floor and the towels they provided were paper thin.
reviews.title: Sad looking rooms but beautiful common area

reviews.text: Overall our stay was okay, but I would probably not come back and would try other accommodations in the same price range. I might stop by and pet Lom though, he was adorable!
reviews.title: What a peaceful, beautiful place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I spent 2 months traveling South America and were lucky enough to spend 4 nights at La Pasada del Fin del Mundo. I can't think of a single complaint. The rooms were impecable, the breakfast was amazing, the tea and fresh pastries provided throughout the day were an extra touch. We were able to easily walk down to the main shopping/food area but still enjoy the peaceful/quiet setting of this B&B. I particularly want to mention the person that made our stay beyond anything expected at any hotel: Marcello. If every hotel had an employee like this, they would all be very successful. Marcello helped with every last detail of our stay. He truly went above and beyond and made this beautiful B&B even more special than it already was. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful Marcello! I wish I could be back there right now! Carey
reviews.title: A very relaxing stay with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we are staying at hostels for most of our trip, Ushuaia is expensive enough already so we decided to spend just a little more to stay at this lovely bed and breakfast. Everything went great from the first email communication, and they organised our pick-up from the airport when we arrived. The first day it felt a little odd because we didn't see Ana, the owner, or any other guests, but it is a very quiet place so it's not surprising. The next morning we were blown away with the breakfast....ham, cheese, croissants, cereal, eggs, dulce de leche and freshly squeezed orange juice. The service is excellent and the room was very comfortable with a great bed, hot shower, TV and adjustable heating. Ana is a really chatty, friendly person and her dog, Lorn is so sweet. We stayed 4 nights and would definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: Lom steals the show
toasty toasty
reviews.text: If you're a fan of dogs, you will love Lom! He's a great character, especially if you're missing your dog from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has a great breakfast and living room and treats (cake and coffee) on the top floor, with a friendly cat and dog. Nice views from up there. The location is a short walk from the main street (San Martin) uphill. We expected a tiled floor (which always seems cleaner to us), but the room had old carpet. It was the cheapest -- and we were out most of the time -- so we can't comment on the others. We'll just use "1980s" as the theme for the decor in the room. Our room also had a tight little toilet stall, but overall it was clean and toasty warm.
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly, and a little odd - in a good way

reviews.text: The rest of the 4 story building is nice - private but like a person's house, too. Ana (the owner and long time resident) and the staff are very nice and are interested in serving you a nice breakfast with high quality ingredients. And they take care with getting you to and from the airport, too.
reviews.title: A gem in the middle of kitsch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Posada is, thankfully, set six blocks above the tourist kitsch of Ushuaia in a quiet neighborhood. Given the odd layout of the town, it is hard to find, at first, without taking a taxi. The 20-year-old inn has recently undergone a major renovation and it glows warmly inside with stone and white plaster walls, hung with original art work, and large picture windows on the third floor public areas with expansive views of the Beagle Channel and the mountains. The rooms are simple but bright, comfortable with good bathrooms. The breakfast in the third floor dining/living room is a delight with eggs cooked to order, meats, cheeses, pastries, breads and fresh squeezed orange juice. Coffee, tea and cakes are available all day. The staff is attentive, friendly and gives excellent advice on area excursions. Wi-Fi - as well as a computer - is available as long as the server is not down (don't blame the Posada, Ushuaia is remote.) I stayed at the Posada for 11 days and was sad to leave.
reviews.title: Very cosy and friendly place.

reviews.text: A wonderful experience made all the better by Ana, the owner, who is always shuffling around and eager to please.
reviews.title: Southern discomfort

likes.disliked: — The room was a complete disappointment

reviews.text: Very cosy & clean, nice staff, good hearty breakfasts, and excellent advice on what to do and how.
reviews.title: B&B with nice living room - Walking distance to main street

description: After several years traveling around the world, finally I arrived to Ushuaia, my land, where I´ve been living for the last 25 years.Since the first day in this charming place, people started coming to me, because of my profesion, my studies, because of my friends or for my adorable sons, who gave personality to this house. If you visit our home, you will be a special guest and you will be part of this marvelous world full of fantasy and lots of human stories, that we call Posada del Fin del Mundo. Certainly you will want to be part of this story that has no end. Ushuaia is the southernmost city in the world. It is located south of the Isla Grande de Tierra del Fuego. One of the most beautifull places to discover. This small, but incredible city, year after year is the destiny of thousands of people who come here looking for nature and adventure, furthermore Ushuaia is also peace, a quiet spot and the door to one of the most fantastic landscapes: Antarctica.
